com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.reflection

Class ClassBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.reflection.ClassBuilder
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    NMSEntityClassBuilder

    public class ClassBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple implementation builder that allows the creation of extensions of classes. This is done by specifying interfaces and implementations for these interfaces.

    To construct new extensions of classes, do the following:
    - Make new interface(s) containing the methods to override
    - Implement these interface(s) in your own implementation class(es)
    - Construct a new Class Builder using the superclass and implementation

    To call super methods in the superclass, add interface methods starting with 'super_'. These methods are never called in the implemented version, you can leave them empty there.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public java.lang.Object create(java.lang.Class<?>[] argumentTypes,
                      java.lang.Object[] arguments,
                      java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> callbacks)
        Creates a new instance using the constructor that matches the argumentTypes, using the arguments. The callbacks are applied to the newly created instance.
        Parameters:
        argumentTypes - of the superclass constructor to use
        arguments - to pass along the superclass constructor
        callbacks - to use for the newly created instance
        Returns:
        a new instance created by this ClassBuilder
